entry.title: CCSCodeStandard
entry.summary:
CCSCodeStandard enforces consistent VB.NET coding & naming standards via Roslyn analyzers and automated fixes.

Core features:

  • Enforces type/prefix conventions (incl. field modifiers) - Type based variable/field/parameter prefixes (int, str, dt, obj, etc.) with field/const modifiers (g/m, gc/mc)
  • Adds missing As clauses & default initializers - Missing 'As' clause detection with quick + combined fixes and automatic default value initialization (locals/fields)
  • Infers / fixes For Each variable typing - Implicit For Each variable typing & renaming (adds As & correct prefix, updates usages)
  • SQL: ensures dbo. prefix & zero size for fixed-size SqlDbTypes - SQL CommandText 'dbo.' prefix enforcement and SQL parameter length validation (prevents >0 length on Int/DateTime parameters)
  • Naming: short/underscore identifier warnings & quick renames - Short name (len <=3) expansion suggestions and variable names with underscore detection & fix recommendations
  • Logical & null pattern normalization (AndAlso/OrElse, Is / IsNot Nothing) - "And/Or" replacement with "AndAlso/OrElse" (except for bit comparisons) and "Is Nothing" / "IsNot Nothing" standardization (replaces = Nothing and <> Nothing)
  • Inserts error handlers & missing Function returns - Error handler validation for functions with automatic insertion and empty return path detection in Function calls with fixes
  • String.Empty & other constant usage suggestions - String literal standardization (replaces "" with String.Empty where appropriate)
  • Mixed logical operators warning (add parentheses)
  • Avoid CommandType.Text (prefer stored procedure)
  • Bulk Fix support for fast cleanup - Bulk Fix window: select / filter / apply & save all fixes at once
  • Bulk Fix list: right-click "Go to line" to open the file at the diagnostic
  • Navigates to and selects the exact offending span (e.g., the variable for PrefixConvention) in the editor for quick fixing

Compatible with Visual Studio 2019-2022 and .NET Framework projects

Remember Ant is watching
